text:
Whose woods these are I think I know.
His house is in the village, though;
He will not see me stopping here
To watch his woods fill up with snow.
explanation: I believe I know who owns these woods, but his residence is in the nearby village. Even though he won't witness my pause here, I'm going to take a moment to observe as the snow accumulates on the trees in the woods.

text:
My little horse must think it queer
To stop without a farmhouse near
Between the woods and frozen lake
The darkest evening of the year.
explanation: My small horse must be wondering why we're stopping in the middle of nowhere on the darkest night of the year, with nothing but woods and a frozen lake around us.

text:
He gives his harness bells a shake
To ask if there is some mistake.
The only other sound’s the sweep
Of easy wind and downy flake.
explanation: He shakes his harness bells, wondering if there has been an error. The only noise he hears is the gentle wind and the soft flakes of snow falling.

text:
The woods are lovely, dark, and deep,
But I have promises to keep,
And miles to go before I sleep,
And miles to go before I sleep.
explanation: The forest is beautiful, with its darkness and depth, but I have commitments to honor and a long journey ahead of me before I can rest. There are many miles left to travel before I can finally sleep.

text:
When most I wink, then do mine eyes best see,
For all the day they view things unrespected;
But when I sleep, in dreams they look on thee,
And darkly bright, are bright in dark directed.
Then thou, whose shadow shadows doth make bright,
How would thy shadow’s form form happy show
To the clear day with thy much clearer light,
When to unseeing eyes thy shade shines so!
How would, I say, mine eyes be blessed made
By looking on thee in the living day,
When in dead night thy fair imperfect shade
Through heavy sleep on sightless eyes doth stay!
All days are nights to see till I see thee,
And nights bright days when dreams do show thee me.
explanation: When I close my eyes, I see things more clearly than when they are open during the day. During the day, my eyes see things that are not important, but at night I dream of you and your image is vivid in my mind. Your shadow makes everything bright and happy, and I can only imagine how beautiful you would be in the daylight. I long to see you in person during the day, but even in my sleep, your imperfect image brings me joy. Every day is dark until I see you, and every night is bright when I dream of you.

text:
Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high
Where knowledge is free
Where the world has not been broken up into fragments
By narrow domestic walls
Where words come out from the depth of truth
Where tireless striving stretches its arms towards perfection
Where the clear stream of reason has not lost its way
Into the dreary desert sand of dead habit
Where the mind is led forward by thee
Into ever-widening thought and action
Into that heaven of freedom, my Father, let my country awake.
explanation: This passage describes an ideal world where people are not held back by fear or narrow-mindedness. Knowledge is freely accessible and the world is not divided by barriers. People speak truthfully and strive for perfection tirelessly. Reason remains clear and active, not bogged down by negative habits. The mind is guided towards progress and constantly expanding its understanding of the world. In this world, freedom reigns and the speaker hopes that their country can achieve this state.

text:
You may write me down in history
With your bitter, twisted lies,
You may trod me in the very dirt
But still, like dust, I’ll rise.
explanation: Although you endeavor to defame me in the annals of time with your malicious and distorted fabrications, and even if you tread upon me in the soil, I will still persevere and ascend, akin to the particles of dust.

text:
Does my sassiness upset you?
Why are you beset with gloom?
‘Cause I walk like I’ve got oil wells
Pumping in my living room.
explanation: Are you bothered by my confidence and boldness? Is there a reason for your sadness and negativity towards me? Perhaps it's because I carry myself with an air of abundance and prosperity, as if I have vast resources at my disposal.

text:
Just like moons and like suns,
With the certainty of tides,
Just like hopes springing high,
Still I’ll rise.
explanation: I will rise with the same steadfastness as the cycles of the moon and sun, and the predictable ebb and flow of the tides. My hopes will soar with determination and perseverance, and I will continue to rise above any challenges or obstacles.

text:
Did you want to see me broken?
Bowed head and lowered eyes?
Shoulders falling down like teardrops.
Weakened by my soulful cries.
explanation: Are you hoping to witness my downfall? To see me defeated and submissive with my head hung low and eyes cast downward? My shoulders drooping under the weight of my tears and my spirit weakened by my desperate pleas.

text:
Does my haughtiness offend you?
Don’t you take it awful hard
‘Cause I laugh like I’ve got gold mines
Diggin’ in my own back yard.
explanation: Are you bothered by my arrogance? Please don't take it too personally. I am just very confident and happy, as if I have struck gold in my own backyard, and I express this through my laughter.

text:
You may shoot me with your words,
You may cut me with your eyes,
You may kill me with your hatefulness,
But still, like air, I’ll rise.
explanation: Despite the verbal and emotional attacks I may face, I will not be defeated. Your words and actions may hurt me, but they will not break me. I will rise above your hate and prejudice, much like the air that continues to exist despite being pushed down.

text:
Does my sexiness upset you?
Does it come as a surprise
That I dance like I’ve got diamonds
At the meeting of my thighs?
explanation: Does it bother you that I am sexy and confident? Are you taken aback by the way I move with grace and poise, exuding a radiance that shines bright like diamonds?

text:
Out of the huts of history’s shame
I rise
Up from a past that’s rooted in pain
I rise
I’m a black ocean, leaping and wide,
Welling and swelling I bear in the tide.
Leaving behind nights of terror and fear
I rise
Into a daybreak that’s wondrously clear
I rise
Bringing the gifts that my ancestors gave,
I am the dream and the hope of the slave.
I rise
I rise
I rise.
explanation: I emerge from the dark past that has brought shame and pain to my people. I am like a vast and powerful ocean, surging forward with strength and determination. The terrors and fears of the past are behind me, and I welcome the bright and promising dawn of a new day. I carry with me the legacy of my ancestors, who dreamed of a better life and fought for freedom. I am a symbol of their hope and resilience, rising up to meet every challenge with courage and grace.

text:
The song I came to sing
remains unsung to this day.
I have spent my days in stringing
and in unstringing my instrument.
explanation: The song that I intended to sing has yet to be sung. Instead, I have spent my time repeatedly tuning and untuning my instrument.

text:
The time has not come true,
the words have not been rightly set;
only there is the agony
of wishing in my heart...
explanation: The moment has yet to arrive, and the words have not been expressed correctly. All that exists is the pain of yearning in my heart.

text:
I have not seen his face,
nor have I listened to his voice;
only I have heard his gentle footsteps
from the road before my house...
explanation: I have not had the opportunity to see him face-to-face or hear him speak, but I am familiar with the sound of his soft footsteps as he passes by my house on the road.
The lamp isn't lit, so I can't invite him inside. I'm hopeful that I'll eventually cross paths with him, but it hasn't happened yet.

text:
I wanted to disappear— so I opened the door to a stranger's car. he was divorced. He
was still alive. He was sobbing into his hands (hands that tasted like rust). The pink
breast cancer ribbon on his keychain swayed in the ignition. Don't we touch each other
just to prove we are still here? I was still here once. The moon, distant & flickering,
trapped itself in beads of sweat on my neck. I let the fog spill through the cracked
window & cover my fangs. When I left, the Buick kept sitting there, a dumb bull in
pasture, its eyes searing my shadow onto the side of suburban homes. At home, I
threw myself on the bed like a torch & watched the flames gnaw through my mother's
house until the sky appeared, bloodshot & massive. How I wanted to be that sky— to
hold every flying & falling at once.
explanation: The speaker was feeling a desire to disappear and ended up getting into a stranger's car. The man driving was divorced and crying into his hands, which tasted like rust. The pink breast cancer ribbon on his keychain moved back and forth as the car started. The speaker wonders if we touch each other to prove that we are still alive. The moon was shining on the speaker's neck, which was covered in sweat. The speaker let the fog in through the open window and covered their fangs. When the speaker left the car, the Buick stayed there like a bull in a pasture. The speaker goes home and watches the flames from their mother's house consume everything until the sky appears. The speaker wishes they could be that sky and hold everything at once.
